result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan A. Caruso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previoulsy provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge  May Not have contact with drug users/dealers unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 9/10/15 paid by county $75.00 for files 13cf714,14cf227,14cf1221
9/10/15 - Disposition - Two years initial incarceration (Original filed in 13CF714)
Presentence incarceration credit.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions, consecutive to 13CF714 & 14CF1221; pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/10/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Marry and ADA McNeill the FPT of 5/7/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled; as the deft is in outpatient treatment and will be done in 9 weeks; reset to 7/28/15 at 8:30am.
Notice of Hearing Cancellation

*Must comply w/every requirement to the alternative to revocation.  *Must participate in alcohol/drug treatment program and any mental health program recommended, any violation should result in immediate incarceration.  *Not to operate a vehicle without a valid license.  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  
946349(1)(b) - Felony BJ

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty P Marry appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Marry's motion to modify bond.  Court amends bond to a $5,000 signature bond, *Must comply w/every requirement to the alternative to revocation.  *Must participate in alcohol/drug treatment program and any mental health program recommended, any violation should result in immediate incarceration.  *Not to operate a vehicle without a valid license.  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
from DE
Bond motion; filed by Atty P Marry.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty P Marry appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Bond remains in effect.  FPT of 3/23/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled to after the SEHR in file 14CF218; reset to 5/7/15 at 8:45am.
Certificates of Completion

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft has a SAR pending in Washington County.  FPT continued to 3/23/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Marry the FPT of 2/10/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled, to a date when ADA McNeill is available; reset to 2/12/15 at 9am.
946349(1)(b) - Felony BJ

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 2/10/15 at 8:45am.  Deft revokes her signature on bond.  Court sets cash bond in the amount of $10,000.
